title: Access to HSBC online banking
content: For years I’ve had no difficulty accessing online my HSBC bank accounts in UK using Firefox. In recent days they have changed their security access method whereby their site now requests a security number generated on one’s phone using the HSBC App (it used to be a random number from an HSBC supplied handheld device) which then has to be input via my Windows 10 PC to access my data. If I use Microsoft Edge as browser, everything works fine, but when I try Firefox my system just hangs after I’ve put my bank ID into the HSBC opening page (the first security step) and simply never opens the next HSBC page which would ask me to generate the said code on my phone. Seems a browser related problem. Any ideas why Edge works but Firefox does not?
creator: keith.pottinger

creator: in2mailbox

title: On certain domain, firefox stop loading the page for a while
content:
This bug occurs very randomly, but it seems there have few things in common.

- Occurring on domain level, one domain at once. For example, if Youtube.com stuck, any sub address including each video page is not loaded. Other website and whole browser works fine. - Other program on same PC is not affected, too. - Which page is stop loading is completely random. It might be happen only on a popular, feature-rich site like amazon, google, but not sure. - The timing is also random. Maybe after waking PC up from sleep, but not sure. Frequency of occurrence is once every 1~5 days. - The workaround without restarting browser is 1.)switching to other container tabs(strangely), 2.)opening website on private window. Disabling all the addon manually didn't help.

Since it's randomness, I didn't have any logs about this issue.
creator: bleepblopp

title: How to increase the font size in the right click context menu? (2)
content:
Greetings... I would like to increase the font size in right click menu box in FF 89.0 (64-bit) (see attached png)

I found a similar 2018 query here at: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1241117#answer-1174375

and based on that exchange I added the following to userChrome.css file

/* FONT SIZE IN RIGHT CLICK MENU BOXES 5/1/22 */

  1. mainPopupSet menuitem,
  2. mainPopupSet menu { font-size: 16pt !important; }

/* */

I closed and reopened FF. This change has no effect on the menu font no matter what font-size value I enter. Have I done something wrong?
creator: rarebooks

title: Desde la última actualización Firefox se bloquea aleatoriamente (hay que cerrarlo con Ctrl + Alt + Supr) - Firefox ver. 99.0.1 64 bits
content:
Firefox se bloquea y no soy el único al que le pasa este problema. Borrar el historial de las cookies NO ARREGLA el problema, lo digo porque otros usuarios tienen el mismo problema y se les ha sugerido esto. No sirve para nada.

Parece que desde la última actualización Firefox entra en contacto con algunas webs y por alguna razón, el navegador se bloquea completamente.

He notado que esto suele ocurrir en las páginas webs de los períodicos

www.abc.es www.elpaís.es www.elmundo.es

Cuando la página es compleja el navegador se bloquea. Normalmente las páginas de períodicos dan problemas.

Espero que den con una solución con esto porque es realmente molesto.

El problema se extiende también a Thunderbird.

No ocurre en ninguna otra aplicación de mi PC ni en ningún otro navegador.

title: Unsync my Firefox account from someone else's computer from a distance when no password was required
content:
Hi. I was visiting someone and while I was there, I synced my Firefox account to his computer so I could do my personal business on it. I had it set up so I didn't need to log in before using Firefox, though. I've seen instructions for how to unsync a device at a distance that advise one to change one's Firefox password, but I am not sure whether this would work in my case since I didn't have things set up on the other computer to require a Firefox password. If I changed my password, would the other computer revert to requiring a password to open Firefox?

The second part of the instructions I read advise one to also change all one's other passwords: "If you don't change the passwords for things like your bank account, it would still be possible for someone else to log into your account on your lost device." I don't understand why this would be the case. Since I have over 200 passwords, this would also be completely impractical for me. Could someone please shed some light on this matter? Thanks.
creator: alexbaez333

title: -private-window Argument Not Working
content: macOS. Firefox is running. I enter: open -a Firefox --args -private-window "https://apple.com" (in Terminal or Automator) which I believe should open apple.com in a new private window, but although the focus change to the already open Firefox window, a new private window does not open. It does work (apple.com opens in a new private window) if Firefox is not already running, but I thought the -private-window argument is supposed to open a new private window whether Firefox is already running or not. What have I got wrong?

title: toggle tracking protection, and not being able to view full web pages
content:
hello there!

i have had this persistent issue: when a site seems broken, i used to be able to try turning off Enhanced Tracking Protection, by 

   Clicking on the shield Icon to the left of the address bar, then    Toggling the switch at the top of the panel.

But for the past week or two, the toggle button stays on and i canno toggle it off.

Also, a related issue, ie.the reason ive mos recently tried to do this, is so i can view the whole yelp review web pages. I used to be able to, but fo the pas few weeks a large portion of these pages hav blanks instead of reviews. I cannot even view the review i myself posted a week ago!

For example, this yelp business page link text

if you scroll down to beneath of where it says:

'''Ask the Community Ask a question Yelp users haven’t asked any questions yet about Precision Dentistry.'''

there should be text and photos of companies' reviews and info. But instead, all i ever see are grayed out empty boxes.

I have tried: 

disabling all my add-ons,

private browing mode, 

restarting firefox,

turning of all tracking protection from the main firefox preferences pane, rebooting my computer, and clearing all history for everything. I have also googled this up the yinyang but no one else seems to be having similar issues.

Any ideas? if you could please help with this issue i'd be very grateful!

title: Losing scrollbar arrows after every upgrade
content: I lost my arrows on my scrollbar again after an update early last month. I tried adding lines to the gtk.css config files with no success unlike I've been successful doing in the past. It appears they are gone forever unless I can find another way to get them back. I noticed that the scrollbar arrows are gone on only Firefox and Thunderbird. As mentioned, this has happened in the past after some updates but in the past I was able to edit the gtk.css files in both gtk-2.0 and gtk-3.0 to get them back. Is there anything else I can try. I'm using the latest version of Ubuntu (Pop OS to be specific) and the arrows to the scrollbars disappeared around April 2nd for both Firefox and Thunderbird. I didn't notice any other applications where the arrows to the scrollbars disappeared. Is there something else I can try and a way to prevent this from happening in the future. This seems to be a common problem that happens every time there is an update.

title: Linha preta debaixo da barra de pesquisa
content: Baixei o firefox mais cedo, já terminei de trazer tudo do meu navegador antigo pro mesmo, e só sobrou uma coisa que ainda me incomoda, essa linha preta (na imagem). fiquei um bom tempo pesquisando em threads gringas muito antigas no reddit e perguntas no proprio site de suporte mozilla, mas não consegui achar uma solução. tentei mudar varias opcoes no about:config, ate criei um userChrome.css e tentei sumir com a linha usando muitos, muitos codigos diferentes (tinha uma nocao bem superficial de css, nao consegui fazer muita coisa). so desisti e to vindo pedir ajuda aqui mesmo, por mais que seja uma coisa trivial, o tanto que essa linha me incomoda é algo surreal
